Title.evidence: Electroacupuncture for Myocardial Protection in Cardiac Surgery: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either EA or control treatment.

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either EA or control treatment.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of electroacupuncture (EA) on myocardial protection and postoperative rehabilitation in patients undergoing cardiac surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of cardiac automatic rebeat after aortic unclamping, measured within 24 hours.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A randomised controlled trial was conducted involving 836 patients undergoing cardiac surgery with CPB.

Result_Outcome.evidence: EA significantly increased the incidence of cardiac automatic rebeat [RR = 1.15, 95% CI (1.01, 1.31), P < 0.05].
